author: Mark Perigard
title: Weekend TV watch
text:
In 1977, it shattered television ratings and started a national conversation on race. Now TV One re-airs the monumental “Roots” miniseries from author Alex Haley in its entirety starting Sunday at 8 p.m. and through Oct. 24. History is producing a remake for 2016 with original star LeVar Burton serving as executive producer.
On the series finale of “Continuum” (tonight at 11 on Syfy), Kiera’s battle against the time marines could prevent her from ever returning home to 2077.
Amy Schumer stars in the stand-up special “Amy Schumer: Live at the Apollo­” (tomorrow at 10 p.m. on HBO), during which she will say all sorts of hilariously inappropriate things about her body, your body and everybody.
On the heels of his unexpected appearance at the Emmys last month, Tracy Morgan returns to his old comedy stomping grounds to host NBC’s “Saturday Night Live” (tomorrow at 11:30 p.m. on WHDH, Ch. 7) — where he will no doubt vow to get everyone in the building pregnant.
Tom Selleck returns as Jesse Stone on a new network, Hallmark Channel, as the troubled lawman investigates a serial killer in Boston in “Jesse Stone: Lost in Paradise” (Sunday at 9 p.m.). The film was shot in Nova Scotia.
Say a little prayer: Oprah Winfrey narrates “Belief,” a seven-part documentary series exploring religious faiths across the world (Sunday through Oct. 24 at 8 p.m. on OWN).
